content.question:
Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = ex and g(x) = ln x.

(a) Find the area of the region enclosed by the graphs of f and g between x = <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and x = 1.

frqParts.text:
Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = ex and g(x) = ln x.

(a) Find the area of the region enclosed by the graphs of f and g between x = <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and x = 1.

(b) Find the volume of the solid generated when the region enclosed by the graphs of f and g between x = <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and x = 1 is revolved about the line y = 4.

(c) Let h be the function given by h(x) = f(x) - g(x). Find the absolute minimum value of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>, and find the absolute maximum value of h(x) on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>. Show the analysis that leads to your answers.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
